DOC.brief_summary: The investigators hypothesized that, in children undergoing venous cannulation for central line placement by pediatric surgeons, ultrasound-guided cannulation leads to an increase in successful venous cannulation at first attempt compared to landmark guided cannulation.
DOC.brief_title: A Prospective Trial of Ultrasound Versus Landmark Guided Central Venous Access in the Pediatric Population
DOC.criteria: All patients between the ages of 0 and 18 years undergoing tunneled central venous line placement under general anesthesia Preoperative proof of nonpatency of central veins coagulopathy access site surgeon
